14.SummaryEnglish: A snake made of straw comes to life. Uesugi Youzan makes things happen.

15.TitleEnglish: The Tofu Priest Statue; Hiraga Gennai
15.SummaryEnglish: A greedy man wants to cheat customers out of tofu. A lowly merchant grows to great riches.

16.SummaryEnglish: A girl sacrifices herself to save her master's daughter. Sen Rikyuu creates a new style of tea.

17.TitleEnglish: Tanuki Fields; The Orange Boat of Bunzaemon
17.SummaryEnglish: Tanuki plow a field for a kind man. Bunzaemon becomes rich selling oranges.

18.TitleEnglish: The Pilgrim and the Bath; The Slaying of the Monster of Himeji Castle
18.SummaryEnglish: A man gets a bathtub stuck to his butt by an angry god. A warrior challenges the ghosts of Himeji castle.

19.TitleEnglish: The Power Given by an Ogre; The Okesabushi of Okei
19.SummaryEnglish: An oni gives a girl great power. A cat of repays the kindness of its owners.

20.TitleEnglish: A Story of Sage Kume; The Moon, the Buddha, and My Soba
20.SummaryEnglish: A man wants to be a Sennin but fails, so he becomes a salesman instead. Kobayashi Issa, the haiku poet, thinks of the sun, the moon, and his soba.

21.SummaryEnglish: A man falls in love with a carp he catches in a lake. A lord learns the ways of herbs.

22.TitleEnglish: Daikoku-sama and Denzaburou the Rich Man; The Tanuki Priest and Kenchin Soup
22.SummaryEnglish: A lazy man becomes rich with the help of a god. A raccoon gathers donations for a temple.

23.TitleEnglish: The Dream-Telling Priest Statue; The Iwatsuki Doll
23.SummaryEnglish: A priest statue gives warnings in dreams. A master dollmaker makes a doll from unique materials.

24.TitleEnglish: Ninja Isuke and the Oosanshouuo; Arita-yaki Shine Like Persimmons
24.SummaryEnglish: A ninja learns secret techniques. New methods for pottery are divised.

25.TitleEnglish: The Rice-Spouting Priest Statue; The Dog Goes to Ise
25.SummaryEnglish: A priest statue spits out yummy rice. A dog goes to Ise.

26.TitleEnglish: The Sesame Seed Manjuu; The Beginning of Dougo Hot Springs
26.SummaryEnglish: A woman uses sesame seed buns to turn people into cows. The hot springs at dogo are discovered.

27.TitleEnglish: Heishirou of Dokkoi Makabe; Standing on Mt. Fuji
27.SummaryEnglish: A boy becomes high priest after a lowly upbringing. A girl becomes the first woman to stand on Mt. Fuji.

28.TitleEnglish: The Bikki Wife; The Oumi Merchant
28.SummaryEnglish: A man marries a frog wife. A merchant from Edo teaches people a valuable lesson about quality goods.

29.TitleEnglish: The Ship Ghosts of Usa; The Tanuki War of Awa
29.SummaryEnglish: A ship of ghosts tries to drag the living to the bottom of the ocean. Raccoons fight a war in Awa.

30.TitleEnglish: The Rain of the Setomono Festival; The Silkworm and the Wife Lord
30.SummaryEnglish: A hard-working potter learns the secrets of lacquerware. In Shirataki, the wife is the boss.

31.SummaryEnglish: A man becomes a doctor after his eyeball falls out. In Aizu, the Byakkotai dies at the end of a war.

32.TitleEnglish: The Priest and the Old Tanuki; Otane's Lake
32.SummaryEnglish: A priest becomes friends with an old raccoon. A beautiful woman called Otane meets a sad fate.

33.TitleEnglish: The Man Who Wanted to be a Black Kite; The Mountain Princess of Yakushima
33.SummaryEnglish: A man wants to be a black kite. A sinister creature haunts a tree on a island.

34.TitleEnglish: Wanting To Be Poor; The Blessings of Uzumi
34.SummaryEnglish: A man wants to be poor. A lord forbids his people from luxuries.

35.TitleEnglish: Yajiemon and the Big Bear; Nikkou Toushougu and Hidari Jingorou
35.SummaryEnglish: Yajiemon fights a giant bear. A man designs the gate for a temple after badly injuring his left hand.

36.TitleEnglish: The God Riding on a Cucumber; Use an Abacus to Make Kaga a Million Koku
36.SummaryEnglish: A god rides on a cucumber. A lord becomes rich using his abacus to keep expenses down.

37.TitleEnglish: The Farting Wife; The Chef of Shuri Castle
37.SummaryEnglish: A wife farts so hard that she blows down trees. A chef in Okinawa competes for the best dish.

38.SummaryEnglish: A mountain granny brings prosperity in exchange for delicious mochi. Horrible creatures called Namahage strike a town in Akita.

39.TitleEnglish: The Invisible Man; The River Otter of Shimanto River
39.SummaryEnglish: A man becomes invisible and feels very alone. A river otter is tricked by dastardly shrimp.

40.TitleEnglish: Three Grains of Rice, Three Grains of Gold; Jirochou of Shimizu
40.SummaryEnglish: Three grains of rice become three grains of gold. A man named Jirochou is an inpsiration to everyone.

41.TitleEnglish: The Swordsman and the Bale of Straw; The Pack Carriers of Mackerel Highway
41.SummaryEnglish: A samurai breaks a teacup owned by a poor man. Pack runners carry salmon along a mountain path.

42.TitleEnglish: Mountain Granny Shrine; Sugawara Michizane and the Legend of the Flying Plum
42.SummaryEnglish: A mountain grannie repays those who are kind to her. A child prodigy is banished far from the capital.

43.TitleEnglish: The Paper Bag Wind; Tanabata-san's Present
43.SummaryEnglish: A man bags the wind. An ancient legend about Tanabata is still told to this day.

44.TitleEnglish: The Mountain Monk Tanuki; The Doll Stones of Kintai Bridge
44.SummaryEnglish: A raccoon disguises itself as a mountain monk. A woman is sacrificed to make a bridge sturdy.

45.TitleEnglish: Yagorou-don and the Men; The Bug-Sending of Tsugaru
45.SummaryEnglish: A giant called Yagorou-dono lived long ago. A god drives away insects from crops.

46.SummaryEnglish: A boy called Ishidoumaru searches for his father. A lord battles a monster in his keep.

47.TitleEnglish: The Colt that Escaped from a Painting; The Cold Soup Granny
47.SummaryEnglish: A horse from a painting comes alive. A recipe is made for cold soup.

48.TitleEnglish: The Monk Who Went to Hell; Mito Mitsukuni Is Hungry
48.SummaryEnglish: A greedy priest is sent to hell. A great man named Mito Mitsukuni is very hungry.

49.TitleEnglish: The 16th Day Cherry Tree; Monkey Bridge
49.SummaryEnglish: A cherry tree blooms on the night of the full moon. A bridge-maker makes a bride over a steep canyon.

50.TitleEnglish: The Gongen-sama on the Northern Mountain; Anchin and Kiyohime
50.SummaryEnglish: A goddess lives on the northern mountain. Kiyohime becomes a snake and attacks the one she loves. Final episode
